text:
Hi,

Iam working on a project which uses FOP to generate pdf using the XSL-FO.  
I am fairly new to this, based on the examples I was able to completed all the 
tasks except for one. 

The problem in a nut shell is I have an XML file which has the data and XSL 
file which defines the presentation. 
Primarily the page consists of 3 columns and the third column has two nested 
tables. All the data are displayed perfectly except for the link. When the link 
is displayed in the document and when I mouse over the document, only some part 
of the link seems to be clickable.  For those links that are outside from this 
table is working fine. 

The operating system which we are using is Windows 2000 SP3, to read pdf we are 
using Acrobat Reader 5.1. We are using the fop-0.20.5 from apache to render the 
page.

For this problem I could'nt not find a solution. Could you please let me know 
the cause of this problem and how this can be solved. Since we are at the stage 
where we need to implement this feature as early possible, I request you to 
kindly look into the issue and help us out in solving the problem. 

Awaiting your response.

Thanks in advance.
Suresh.S
creator: suresh@xm-asia.com

text:
Are you certain the problem is with FOP and not Adobe Acrobat?

I doubt we can fix your problem in the timeframe desired--and we don't make 
many changes to the maintenance branch (0.20.5) anymore--however, it may be 
helpful if you (1) attached to this bug a *minimal* XSL FO document that causes 
your problem to occur, and (2) attached the resultant PDF document that FOP 
created for you with (1), so we can see the problem.  Of course, don't attach 
anything with sensitive information.

text:
The PDF document is doing the same thing on my side as yours.

But, I ran your xml & xsl through Xalan--one thing I noticed in the FO output 
are lots of nonsensical Â (A-caret?) letters--I don't see why you need them.  
There appears to be something wrong with your stylesheet.

Also, running the FO output through FOP gave a warning that you have specified 
your column widths about 25% too wide.  (Sum about 500K, specified IPD 417K or 
so.)  This may be the source of your problem--your columns are too narrow, and 
your results would therefore be undefined.  Also, there were complaints about 
missing images, etc., so that may be an issue.

Finally, in a separate, simple document I created two PDF links--one outside a 
table and one within in a simple file in 0.20.5--works fine!--So I believe the 
problem is with your XSL FO document.  I'm attaching a sample XSL FO document 
and resultant PDF--you can see that the links work fine.  

Somehow, perhaps by correcting your XSL FO you should be able to get the links 
to work like they do in my sample document.  But right now, there are too many 
things messy/wrong with your stylesheet for it to indicate that the problem is 
with FOP.  At any rate, we are making very few changes to our 0.20.x branch, 
and given that the fo:basic-link mostly work, changes do not appear called for 
at this time.
